meanings.definition: The position or role of a proctor.
meanings.sent1: In the school, the proctorships were given to responsible students.
meanings.sent2: The proctorships at the exam hall ensured fairness and order.
meanings.sent3: The proctorships had to keep a close eye on the students during the test.
meanings.sent4: She took on the proctorships with a watchful gaze, like a hawk.
meanings.sent5: The proctorships were like guardians, overseeing the exam process.

meanings.definition: The duties or responsibilities of a proctor.
meanings.sent1: Completing the proctorships required attention to detail and fairness.
meanings.sent2: His proctorships included monitoring the exam room and answering questions.
meanings.sent3: The proctorships involved ensuring no cheating occurred during the test.
meanings.sent4: She handled her proctorships with care, like delicate glass.
meanings.sent5: The proctorships demanded vigilance and integrity at all times.

meanings.definition: The term of office for a proctor.
meanings.sent1: Her proctorships lasted for a year before a new proctor took over.
meanings.sent2: The proctorships typically lasted until the end of the academic year.
meanings.sent3: The proctorships were like a baton passed from one person to the next.
meanings.sent4: He embraced his proctorships with dedication until the end of his term.
meanings.sent5: The proctorships marked a period of responsibility and service for each individual.
